content: I spent last night and tonight at the guest house in Fort Lee VA. As I was sitting outside of the main PX waiting for my wife to come out I over heard a young recruit talking to a female and another recruit about the Army. One of the recruits, the ugly, skinny one with glasses said,"I don't know what this new Army is all about. They took me and I'm on two medications for being mentally disturbed". I don't know if he was kidding or not but he did look mentally disturbed. I was also amased at the new apartments they live in, the cars they drive, the things they buy now a days and the way they act. I told my wife that in a few more years don't be surprised to see two young male E-4s walking into the PX holding hands.

I don't know if he was kidding or not but he did look mentally disturbed. I was also amased at the new apartments they live in, the cars they drive, the things they buy now a days and the way they act. I told my wife that in a few more years don't be surprised to see two young male E-4s walking into the PX holding hands.
title: What kind of new Army is this?

content: Actually, all they have to do is wave the High School Grad requirement and go back to GEDing people once they are in . . .the ranks would probably fill right up - - They could start those without High School Diplomas at half pay with the caveat that if the can't hack it, out they go. They could only sign up for straight leg, no frills Infantry, but as they progress through training and schooling, they could opt for other MOSs after 2 years with an extension of another 3 years or more... Wandering and Wondering

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I spent last night and tonight at the guest house in Fort Lee VA. As I was sitting outside of the main PX waiting for my wife to come out I over heard a young recruit talking to a female and another recruit about the Army. One of the recruits, the ugly, skinny one with glasses said,"I don't know what this new Army is all about. They took me and I'm on two medications for being mentally disturbed". I don't know if he was kidding or not but he did look mentally disturbed. I was also amased at the new apartments they live in, the cars they drive, the things they buy now a days and the way they act. I told my wife that in a few more years don't be surprised to see two young male E-4s walking into the PX holding hands. I don't think think is something new. In the mid 80's there are 2 individuals who were in the Army( I'm sure there was more.). In A.I.T. one guy had really bad posture,really hunched over,could never stand up straight,poor, hygene. Some one told him to stand up straight, said he could not because of physical deformity in his back. Another, they made him into a cook. I asked one of the cooks who worked with him why he always had the job of filling up the bread dispenser, basically was everyone's "go for boy". He did not do any actual cooking. they explained he had been on a tank crew was mentally slow, could not understand orders etc. Filling the bread dispenser was all he could handle. I would say through out history, the Army has had its share of people that make you go WTF! Is this legal? I don't know,but its fun isn't?!
